#Text=CanadaVOTES : Liberal David Remington running in Lanark — Frontenac — Lennox & Addington
#Text=Friday , September 19 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=Liberal candidate David Remington is standing for election in the riding of Lanark — Frontenac — Lennox and Addington .
#Text=Wikinews contacted David Remington , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?
#Text=I want to give people a chance .
#Text=For 20 years I have been working in the community , serving on numerous volunteer boards , and municipal council .
#Text=I believe the Federal Government needs to be more involved in the everyday lives of Canadians .

#Text=I think the Federal Government has been too far removed and we must work together with municipal , provincial and federal levels of government to find solutions to the issues we have in communities across the country .
#Text=I believe the Liberal party of Canada is the party that supports everyday Canadians who are trying to make ends meet .
#Text=We are the party with that believes in the role of government .
#Text=I truly believe we are judged by how well we treat the least fortunate among us and Liberal party is committed to helping all Canadians reach their full potential .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=I have been in business for 20 years and have served as a municipal councilor , deputy mayor and Mayor of the Town of Greater Napanee .
#Text=I have served on numerous boards for 20 years and have a diploma in Restorative Justice from Queen 's Theological College .
#Text=I have a proven track record of working with others in the community to make things happen and get things done .
#Text=I have worked to attract new business , spearheaded a new community centre , and have been involved in many social programs to help low income Canadians .

#Text=I will be a community based politician who believes that if we work together we can find innovative solutions to create jobs , invest in health care , tackle child poverty and seriously address the major environmental threats facing us .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=The four issues that keep coming up at the door on a regular basis are : Environment , Economy , Child Poverty , Health Care
#Text=The average family household earning is $ 40,000 in my riding .
#Text=A family of four will receive a net benefit of $ 1,600.00 per year through a personal income tax cut under the Liberal Green Shift .
#Text=The 700 largest polluters will pay the bulk of the new price on carbon which will then be returned to Canadians through Personal Income Tax Cuts .
#Text=I will work with community partners to create jobs in our local community .

#Text=There are several Federal Programs we can bring to the local level such as the Community Futures Development Corporation which is federally funded , and run by a local board of directors who lend money to small and mid sized businesses .
#Text=I will work to bring High Speed internet to the entire riding so folks can work from home and businesses will locate in our rural communities .
#Text=We need to have equal access for all Canadians to work from home .
#Text=The Liberal Green Shift will provide families with children an additional $ 350.00 per child , helping many low income families .
#Text=We will also continue with the 1,200.00 families receive for each child $ 100.00 per month under the current governments child benefit .
#Text=I will work with low income folks and agencies that serve low income people to ask what they need and support them with available federal government programs .
#Text=I will support funding for housing for low income Canadians .
#Text=A new Liberal government has committed $ 900 million dollars for medical drugs that sick people require and that are currently not covered by drug plans .
#Text=I support preventative health care measures in the community such as Community Health Care Centres and the use of nurse practitioners to ease up the load on doctors .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=The Liberal Green Shift provides significant income tax cuts for everyday Canadians .
#Text=Many people only think there is a price on carbon and do not understand that they will receive personal income tax cuts which will more than offset the price of carbon .

#Text=The average family will pay an additional $ 250.00 in direct costs to heat their home with oil or natural gas and the average family earning $ 40,000 per year will receive a Personal Income Tax Cut of $ 1,850.00 leaving them a net benefit of $ 1,600.00
#Text=There are more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=I have used a variety of methods to get our message out from door to door canvass , phoning people , web site , facebook and a blog .
#Text=I believe a successful campaign should include all aspects to reach the variety of voters we are trying to engage .
